Large-scale Sequencing

Back To Projects
GitHub
Research Paper Published On Top Journal

Introduction

In this study, we performed tissue specific deletion to determine the role of Smad4 in chondrocyte hypertrophic differentiation during endochondral bone formation in mouse limb. We found that loss of Smad4 within the limb resulted in absence of chondrocyte hypertrophy and ossification in humerus. To further determine how the skeletal defects arise in the mutants, we performed RNA-Seq along with ChIP-Seq analysis and found that Smad4 directly binds to Runx2 regulatory elements. Our data suggest a mechanism that Smad4 controls chondrocyte hypertrophy through regulating Runx2 expression during mouse skeletal development. The regulatory mechanism between Smad4 and Runx2 provides critical insights into the pathogenesis of chondrodysplasia.

Implementation

RNA-seq analysis in the next step involves alignment. Bowtie (http://bowtie-bio.sourceforge.net/index.shtml), Burrows-Wheeler Aligner (BWA http://bio-bwa.sourceforge.net/), Maq (http://maq.sourceforge.net/), Mosaik(http://gkno.me/), NovoAlign (http://www.novocraft.com/products/novoalign/), SEAL (http://biodoop-seal.sourceforge.net/), Stampy (http://www.well.ox.ac.uk/project-stampy) and so on are some short, unspliced aligners. STAR (http://code.google.com/p/rna-star/), Bowtie2 (http://bowtie-bio.sourceforge.net/bowtie2/index.shtml), TopHat (https://ccb.jhu.edu/software/tophat/index.shtml) and so on are examples of spliced/gapped aligners. Normalization, quantitative analysis and differential expression analysis can be done using BaySeq (http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/baySeq.html), Cufflinks/Cuffdiff (http://cole-trapnell-lab.github.io/cufflinks/), DESeq(http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/DESeq.html), EdgeR(https://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/edgeR.html), NOISeq(https://www.bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/NOISeq.html), HTSeq (http://www-huber.embl.de/HTSeq/doc/install.html) and so on. MACS, Model-based Analysis for ChIP-seq allows a more sensitive and robust prediction of peaks using dynamic Poisson distribution. It models the length of the sequenced ChIP fragments to improve the spatial resolution of predicted binding sites (http://liulab.dfci.harvard.edu/MACS/).

Highlight

Experienced with Minerva supercomputer.
Linux system operation.
Huge data retrieval and process.
Lots of scientific computing packages.
R ggplot2 visualization.
Venn diagram.
Histogram.

Achievement

This was an entirely unexpected project. As a cardiology-related lab, we were trying to find cardiac defects by conditional knocking out of SMAD4, but we did not found anything wrong in the heart. However, we found loss of bones in the limbs. So this project is now cooperating with a bone-related research lab for further discoveries. (Updated: the research was published on The Journal of Biological Chemistry in 2018)
